author: 30_50_feralhogs
content: Hey guys. I'm trying to learn more about the topography of Ethereum nodes and its effect on transaction propagation (delays etc.) I've seen a number of papers claiming Ethereum is heavily clustered, e.g. https://dl.acm.org/doi/10.1145/3384943.3409418 :" There are a few critical nodes that have a significant impact on the robustness and vulnerability of the whole system". Does anyone have any resources around this? The motivating question is to "how to get a transaction to propagate as fast as possible".

author: 30_50_feralhogs
content: For example, using a public Infura node, I routinely find my txs land on the chain 3-4 blocks after I issue them (not due to gas price).

author: 30_50_feralhogs
content: Running a full local node, the delay is, of course, smaller - but it's still there.

author: 30_50_feralhogs
content: and I suspect the reason is network topology, i.e. clustering
